definition[0]: to give someone a very unpleasant shock, so that they feel very upset and frightened
example[0]: She was badly shaken up by the accident.
definition[1]: to make changes to an organization in order to make it more effective
example[1]: the government’s plans to shake up the educational system
definition[2]: to make changes in an organization or system to make it more successful, effective etc
example[2]: They restructured organizations and introduced competition, to shake up monopolies perceived as inefficient and complacent.
